groups.js
Functions
numCmpNumeric compare for sorting.
minGiven a list of numbers, returns the smallest.
maxGiven a list of numbers, returns the largest.
GroupA single group in the tab candy window.
Functions
Group
Variables
_activeTabThe TabItem for the group’s active tab.
defaultNameThe prompt text for the title field.
Functions
setActiveTabSets the active TabItem for this group
getActiveTabGets the active TabItem for this group
getStorageDataReturns all of the info worth storing about this group.
saveSaves this group to persistant storage.
isNewTabsGroupReturns true if the callee is the “New Tabs” group.
getTitleReturns the title of this group as a string.
setTitleSets the title of this group with the given string
adjustTitleSizeUsed to adjust the width of the title box depending on group width and title size.
_getBoundingBoxGiven an array of DOM elements, returns a Rect with the union of their locations.
getContentBoundsReturns a Rect for the group’s content area (which doesn’t include the title, etc).
reloadBoundsSets the bounds based on the location of the group’s container.
setBoundsSets the bounds with the given Rect, animating unless “immediately” is false.
setZSet the Z order for the group’s container, as well as its children.
closeCloses the group, removing (but not closing) all of its children.
closeAllCloses the group and all of its children.
addAdds an item to the group.
removeRemoves an item from the group.
removeAllRemoves all of the group’s children.
setNewTabButtonBoundsUsed for positioning the “new tab” button in the “new tabs” group.
shouldStackReturns true if the group, given “count”, should stack (instead of grid).
arrangeLays out all of the children.
_stackArrangeArranges the children in a stack.
_randRotateRandom rotation generator for _stackArrange
childHitCalled by one of the group’s children when the child is clicked on.
collapseCollapses the group from the expanded “tray” mode.
_addHandlersHelper routine for the constructor; adds various event handlers to the container.
setResizableSets whether the group is resizable and updates the UI accordingly.
newTabCreates a new tab within this groups.
reorderBasedOnTabOrderReorderes the tabs in a group based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the tab bar.
setTopChildSets the Item that should be displayed on top when in stack mode.
getChildReturns the nth child tab or null if index is out of range.
onNextNewTabSets up a one-time handler that gets called the next time a tab is added to the group.
GroupsSingelton for managing all Groups.
Functions
initSets up the object.
getNextIDReturns the next unused group ID.
getStorageDataReturns an object for saving Groups state to persistant storage.
saveAllSaves Groups state, as well as the state of all of the groups.
saveSaves Groups state.
reconstituteRestores to stored state, creating groups as needed.
groupStorageSanityGiven persistant storage data for a group, returns true if it appears to not be damaged.
getGroupWithTitleReturns the Group that has the given title, or null if none found.
getNewTabGroupReturns the “new tabs” Group, or null if not found.
getBoundsForNewTabGroupReturns a Rect describing where the “new tabs” group should go.
repositionNewTabGroupMoves the “new tabs” group to where it should be.
registerAdds the given Group to the list of groups we’re tracking.
unregisterRemoves the given Group from the list of groups we’re tracking.
groupGiven some sort of identifier, returns the appropriate group.
arrangeArranges all of the groups into a grid.
removeAllRemoves all tabs from all groups (which automatically closes all unnamed groups).
newTabGiven a TabItem, files it in the appropriate group.
getActiveGroupReturns the active group.
setActiveGroupSets the active group, thereby showing only the relavent tabs to that group.
updateTabBarForActiveGroupHides and shows tabs in the tab bar based on the active group.
getOrphanedTabsReturns an array of all tabs that aren’t in a group.

Functions

numCmp

var numCmp = function(a,
b)

Numeric compare for sorting.  Private to this file.

min

function min(list)

Given a list of numbers, returns the smallest.  Private to this file.

max

function max(list)

Given a list of numbers, returns the largest.  Private to this file.

Group

A single group in the tab candy window.  Descended from Item.  Note that it implements the Subscribable interface.

Summary

Functions

Group

window.Group = function(listOfEls,
options)

Parameters

listOfElsan array of DOM elements for tabs to be added to this group
optionsvarious options for this group (see below).  In addition, gets passed to add along with the elements provided.

Possible options

idspecifies the group’s id; otherwise automatically generated
lockedsee Item.locked; default is {}
userSizesee Item.userSize; default is null
boundsa Rect; otherwise based on the locations of the provided elements
containera DOM element to use as the container for this group; otherwise will create
titlethe title for the group; otherwise blank
dontPushtrue if this group shouldn’t push away on creation; default is false

Variables

_activeTab

this._activeTab

The TabItem for the group’s active tab.

defaultName

The prompt text for the title field.

Functions

setActiveTab

setActiveTab: function(tab)

Sets the active TabItem for this group

getActiveTab

getActiveTab: function()

Gets the active TabItem for this group

getStorageData

getStorageData: function()

Returns all of the info worth storing about this group.

save

save: function()

Saves this group to persistant storage.

isNewTabsGroup

isNewTabsGroup: function()

Returns true if the callee is the “New Tabs” group.  TODO: more robust

getTitle

getTitle: function()

Returns the title of this group as a string.

setTitle

setTitle: function(value)

Sets the title of this group with the given string

adjustTitleSize

adjustTitleSize: function()

Used to adjust the width of the title box depending on group width and title size.

_getBoundingBox

_getBoundingBox: function(els)

Given an array of DOM elements, returns a Rect with the union of their locations.

getContentBounds

getContentBounds: function()

Returns a Rect for the group’s content area (which doesn’t include the title, etc).

reloadBounds

reloadBounds: function()

Sets the bounds based on the location of the group’s container.

setBounds

setBounds: function(rect,
immediately)

Sets the bounds with the given Rect, animating unless “immediately” is false.

setZ

setZ: function(value)

Set the Z order for the group’s container, as well as its children.

close

close: function()

Closes the group, removing (but not closing) all of its children.

closeAll

closeAll: function()

Closes the group and all of its children.

add

add: function(a,
dropPos,
options)

Adds an item to the group.  Parameters:

aThe item to add.  Can be an Item, a DOM element or a jQuery object.  The latter two must refer to the container of an Item.
dropPosAn object with left and top properties referring to the location dropped at.  Optional.
optionsAn object with optional settings for this call.  Currently the only one is dontArrange.

remove

remove: function(a,
options)

Removes an item from the group.  Parameters:

aThe item to remove.  Can be an Item, a DOM element or a jQuery object.  The latter two must refer to the container of an Item.
optionsAn object with optional settings for this call.  Currently the only one is dontArrange.

removeAll

removeAll: function()

Removes all of the group’s children.

setNewTabButtonBounds

setNewTabButtonBounds: function(box,
immediately)

Used for positioning the “new tab” button in the “new tabs” group.

shouldStack

shouldStack: function(count)

Returns true if the group, given “count”, should stack (instead of grid).

arrange

arrange: function(options)

Lays out all of the children.

Parameters

optionspassed to Items.arrange or _stackArrange

_stackArrange

_stackArrange: function(bb,
options)

Arranges the children in a stack.

Parameters

bbRect to arrange within
optionssee below

Possible “options” properties

animatewhether to animate; default: true.

_randRotate

_randRotate: function(spread,
index)

Random rotation generator for _stackArrange

childHit

childHit: function(child)

Called by one of the group’s children when the child is clicked on.

Returns an object

shouldZoomtrue if the browser should launch into the tab represented by the child
callbackcalled after the zoom animation is complete

collapse

collapse: function()

Collapses the group from the expanded “tray” mode.

_addHandlers

_addHandlers: function(container)

Helper routine for the constructor; adds various event handlers to the container.

setResizable

setResizable: function(value)

Sets whether the group is resizable and updates the UI accordingly.

newTab

newTab: function()

Creates a new tab within this groups.

reorderBasedOnTabOrder

reorderBasedOnTabOrder: function()

Reorderes the tabs in a group based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the tab bar.  It does it by sorting the children of the group by the positions of their respective tabs in the tab bar.

setTopChild

setTopChild: function(topChild)

Sets the Item that should be displayed on top when in stack mode.

getChild

getChild: function(index)

Returns the nth child tab or null if index is out of range.

Parameters

indexthe index of the child tab to return, use negative numbers to index from the end (-1 is the last child)

onNextNewTab

onNextNewTab: function(callback)

Sets up a one-time handler that gets called the next time a tab is added to the group.

Parameters

callbackthe one-time callback that is fired when the next time a tab is added to a group; it gets passed the new tab

Groups

Singelton for managing all Groups.

Summary
Functions
initSets up the object.
getNextIDReturns the next unused group ID.
getStorageDataReturns an object for saving Groups state to persistant storage.
saveAllSaves Groups state, as well as the state of all of the groups.
saveSaves Groups state.
reconstituteRestores to stored state, creating groups as needed.
groupStorageSanityGiven persistant storage data for a group, returns true if it appears to not be damaged.
getGroupWithTitleReturns the Group that has the given title, or null if none found.
getNewTabGroupReturns the “new tabs” Group, or null if not found.
getBoundsForNewTabGroupReturns a Rect describing where the “new tabs” group should go.
repositionNewTabGroupMoves the “new tabs” group to where it should be.
registerAdds the given Group to the list of groups we’re tracking.
unregisterRemoves the given Group from the list of groups we’re tracking.
groupGiven some sort of identifier, returns the appropriate group.
arrangeArranges all of the groups into a grid.
removeAllRemoves all tabs from all groups (which automatically closes all unnamed groups).
newTabGiven a TabItem, files it in the appropriate group.
getActiveGroupReturns the active group.
setActiveGroupSets the active group, thereby showing only the relavent tabs to that group.
updateTabBarForActiveGroupHides and shows tabs in the tab bar based on the active group.
getOrphanedTabsReturns an array of all tabs that aren’t in a group.

Functions

init

init: function()

Sets up the object.

getNextID

getNextID: function()

Returns the next unused group ID.

getStorageData

getStorageData: function()

Returns an object for saving Groups state to persistant storage.

saveAll

saveAll: function()

Saves Groups state, as well as the state of all of the groups.

save

save: function()

Saves Groups state.

reconstitute

reconstitute: function(groupsData,
groupData)

Restores to stored state, creating groups as needed.  If no data, sets up blank slate (including “new tabs” group).

groupStorageSanity

groupStorageSanity: function(groupData)

Given persistant storage data for a group, returns true if it appears to not be damaged.

getGroupWithTitle

getGroupWithTitle: function(title)

Returns the Group that has the given title, or null if none found.

getNewTabGroup

getNewTabGroup: function()

Returns the “new tabs” Group, or null if not found.

getBoundsForNewTabGroup

getBoundsForNewTabGroup: function()

Returns a Rect describing where the “new tabs” group should go.

repositionNewTabGroup

repositionNewTabGroup: function()

Moves the “new tabs” group to where it should be.

register

register: function(group)

Adds the given Group to the list of groups we’re tracking.

unregister

unregister: function(group)

Removes the given Group from the list of groups we’re tracking.

group

group: function(a)

Given some sort of identifier, returns the appropriate group.  Currently only supports group ids.

arrange

arrange: function()

Arranges all of the groups into a grid.

removeAll

removeAll: function()

Removes all tabs from all groups (which automatically closes all unnamed groups).

newTab

newTab: function(tabItem)

Given a TabItem, files it in the appropriate group.

getActiveGroup

getActiveGroup: function()

Returns the active group.  Active means the group where a new tab will live when it is created as well as what tabs are shown in the tab bar when not in the TabCandy interface.

setActiveGroup

setActiveGroup: function(group)

Sets the active group, thereby showing only the relavent tabs to that group.  The change is visible only if the tab bar is visible.

Paramaters

groupthe active Group or <null> if no group is active (which means we have an orphaned tab selected)

updateTabBarForActiveGroup

updateTabBarForActiveGroup: function()

Hides and shows tabs in the tab bar based on the active group.

getOrphanedTabs

getOrphanedTabs: function()

Returns an array of all tabs that aren’t in a group.

A mix-in for allowing objects to collect subscribers for custom events.
this.locked
Affects whether an item can be pushed, closed, renamed, etc
this.userSize
A Point that describes the last size specifically chosen by the user.
arrange: function(items,
bounds,
options)
Arranges the given items in a grid within the given bounds, maximizing item size but maintaining standard tab aspect ratio for each
